textHelp.text1: This tool allows you to change the zoom of the viewer from a panel with a slider. The display map changes zoom in or out as you move the slider up or down.
This tool allows you to change the zoom of the viewer from a panel with a slider. The display map changes zoom in or out as you move the slider up or down.
The base layer selector tool allows you to switch between different base layers or background layers, configured in a viewer.

The location tool allows you to obtain the position of a device and position it on the map. Its operation is restricted to WEB pages that are published securely over the HTTPS protocol and in local environments.
textHelp.text2: If used on a mobile device equipped with a GNSS system, the position will be obtained according to the device's location permissions.
textHelp.text3: On devices without GNSS systems, positioning is obtained using the IP address assigned by the internet operator in a delimited area.

textHelp.text1: Information panel showing the zoom level and approximate scale of the current view.
textHelp.text2: The zoom level is the corresponding one for the EPSG coordinate system: 3857 WGS84 / Pseudo-Mercator.

textHelp.text1: The graphic scale is a line located on the map, often in the margin of the sheet, that has been subdivided into segments to indicate the lengths on the map of terrestrial distance units.
textHelp.text2: Thanks to this element it is possible to measure the real distance directly on the map with the help of a ruler or a compass.

textHelp.text1: The base layer selector tool allows you to switch between different base layers or background layers, configured in a viewer.
textHelp.text2: With this information, attribution can be given to each layer, allowing the user to know its source.

textHelp.text1: The obtain information tool allows obtaining the GetFeatureInfo (the information associated with the point clicked on the viewer) in WMS and WMTS services.
The rotation tool allows you to return the viewer to a North orientation.
textHelp.text2: To be able to rotate the map in the viewer, it is done with the key combination Shit + Alt + left mouse click + move mouse to rotate.
